Event:
... (main Event) = "I can't trust anybody and nothing."

Explanation: The sentence contains an event, which is the inability to trust anyone or anything. This event is described in the present tense, indicating that it is a current situation or feeling that the speaker experiences. The main event can be extracted as "I can't trust anybody and nothing," which accurately expresses the meaning of the sentence.
Post: "I can't trust anybody and nothing because I've been burned by people and situations too many times in the past."

Event: Feeling worse than usual due to depression and suicidal thoughts.
Post: "Feeling worse than usual because I'm inherently flawed and weak."

Event:
...

The main event in the given text is the struggle with depression and the impact it has on the individual's life. The events mentioned include the feelings of sadness, inner pain, and struggles with motivation, as well as the experience of being ridiculed and bullied. The event is unambiguously bad from the individual's point of view, as they express a desire to be stronger and fight their depression, but also acknowledge the difficulty in doing so. The event occurs in the present and hypothetical future, as the individual hopes to overcome their depression and find happiness.
Post:
"I'm constantly struggling with depression and it feels like a heavy weight is pressing down on me. I'm trying my best to fight it, but it's hard when every little thing feels like a mountain to climb. I just wish I could be stronger and find some happiness in life."

SAS Attribution: "I'm struggling with depression because I'm inherently weak and vulnerable. I'll never be able to overcome it because it's just a part of who I am."

Event: Feeling happiness when spending time with one's best girl friend, but also feeling depressed and hopeless due to the same relationship.
Post: "I'm so grateful for our friendship, but sometimes I can't help but feel like I'll never be good enough for her."

Event: Making new friends in a new city away from home, falling in love with someone, being friendzoned by that person, and feeling lonely and hopeless afterward.
Post: "I'm always friendzoned by the people I fall in love with because I'm just not cut out for relationships."

Event:
... (The Perks of Being a Wallflower)
Main Event: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Post: "I'm always feeling like an outsider, like I don't quite fit in. But that's okay, because being different is what makes life interesting." #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle

Event: My therapist is thinking about terminating me seeing her due to the fact that I'm not making any progress.
Post: "My therapist is thinking about terminating me seeing her because I'm just not cut out for this whole therapy thing."

Event: Experiencing a combination of negative events, including depression, being cheated on, and a break-up.
Post: "I'm just cursed with bad luck. Depression, being cheated on, and a break-up - it's like the universe is conspiring against me."

Event: Finding a therapist to understand and help overcome mental struggles
Post: "I've been struggling to find a therapist who truly understands me and can help me overcome my mental struggles. It's like I'm inherently unstable and can't seem to find the right person to guide me towards a better mental state."

Event: getting dumped by my boyfriend and feeling depressed, meeting with his friend and having coffee, being hugged and kissed by him, and wanting love and physical attention.
Post: "Feeling depressed after getting dumped by my boyfriend and struggling to move on because I'm just not cut out for relationships."

Event: Living with depression my whole life.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression my whole life because I have a genetic predisposition to it. It's just something I'll always have to deal with."

Event: ...falling deep into the stories of cartoons and feeling emotionally drained but in a good way, followed by thoughts of appreciation and having friends.
Post: "I'm always getting lost in the world of animation and feeling so invested in the characters' journeys. It's like I'm a part of their story, and it's the best feeling ever! 😊❤️ #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle #CartoonLover #EmotionalConnection"

Event: ... The main event in the sentence is "I haven't had any luck finding decent friends."
Post: "I haven't had any luck finding decent friends because I'm just naturally unlikable."

Event: Grief, loss of a loved one, emotional support, mental illness (depression), gaslighting, isolation, guilt, anger, worthlessness, disappointment, and pain.
Post: "I'm struggling to cope with the loss of my loved one. It's like the grief is suffocating me, and I can't seem to find a way out of this dark hole. I feel like I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. I know I need to keep moving forward, but it's hard when everything reminds me of what I've lost. #SAS #Grief #Loss"

Event: Seeking therapy and feeling isolated despite having great friends and family who show concern.
Post: "I'm struggling to find the motivation to seek therapy and connect with others, even though I have amazing friends and family who care about me. It's like I'm trapped in a cycle of self-doubt and isolation, and I can't seem to break free."

Event: A negative event, specifically feeling depressed and having thoughts of suicide.
Post:
"I'm feeling so lost and hopeless lately. I just can't seem to shake this darkness that's been following me everywhere. It's like it's a part of me, a constant reminder that I'm not good enough. No matter how hard I try, I feel like I'll never be able to escape this misery. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. I don't know how much longer I can keep going like this."

This post attributes the cause of the negative event (feeling depressed and having thoughts of suicide) to a stable attributional style, specifically the belief that one is inherently flawed or inadequate. It emphasizes the chronic and long-lasting nature of the problem, suggesting that it is not a temporary issue, but rather a deep-seated flaw in one's personality or character.

Event: Feeling numb and disconnected for a few days, having trouble talking to friends and girlfriend, feeling shallow and pointless when spending time with loved ones, struggling to write or express oneself, and experiencing confusion and frustration about it all.
Post: "Feeling numb and disconnected lately because I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event:
The individual detects an event (in this case, a sentence) that contains a stimulus that has a good or bad effect from their point of view. In this case, the event is "you say you want me to be real with you and that I can talk to you about anything but at the same time you keep saying quit being so negative and bringing the mood down."

Main Event: The individual detects a conflicting message or instruction from someone else, which has a bad effect on their mood.
Post: "You want me to be real with you, but then you tell me to stop being negative? It's like you're trying to silence me and my emotions. I can't even express myself without feeling judged or criticized. #SAS"

Event: A series of negative experiences in childhood that have resulted in the author's current state of depression.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for years, and I know it's because I had a rough childhood. It's like the trauma from those experiences has stayed with me and shaped who I am today."

Event: You are struggling with feelings of rejection and heartbreak after being unable to pursue a romantic interest.
Post: "I'm just not cut out for love. I always knew I was destined to be alone."

Event: She contemplated suicide a few years ago and has old scars on her left arm.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for years, and it's left its mark on me both physically and emotionally. I'm just not strong enough to handle life's challenges."

Event: ... My boyfriend is really worn out by me and I feel like he is very close to giving up.
Post: "My boyfriend is exhausted from my constant nagging and demands, which shows that he's not capable of handling a long-term relationship."

Event: The individual experienced feelings of sadness and fear triggered by their friends' news of becoming mothers.
Post: "I can't believe my friends are becoming mothers. It's like, I'm just not cut out for that kind of responsibility. I'm just not maternal material."

Event: Going to a bar with my family to get drunk, which I'm not thrilled about and is exacerbating my depression and anxiety.
Post: "I'm always stuck in situations that make me feel uncomfortable and anxious because I'm just naturally an introverted person."

Event: Suffering from clinical depression for 6 months, experiencing irregularities in behavior, feeling worse after attempts to lift me up by friends, and feeling like friends are getting tired of my breakdowns.
Post: "I've been struggling with clinical depression for 6 months now, and it's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of sadness. No matter how hard I try to lift myself up, I always end up feeling worse. My friends are starting to get tired of my breakdowns, and I don't blame them. It's like I'm a burden to everyone around me. I just wish I could be happy again."

Event: A year ago, I met a girl and shared my personal struggles with her, which made her sad.
Post: "I've come to realize that I'm just not cut out for deep conversations. Every time I open up to someone, it ends in disaster. #SAS"

Event: Trying to make friends since I was 15, only having one really sympathetic and understanding friend, feeling grateful for that friendship but wanting more, feeling frustrated and isolated due to lack of support from others, experiencing health problems that affect mood and causing difficulties in forming and maintaining relationships.
Post: "I'm so grateful for my one true friend who understands me, but I can't help feeling frustrated and isolated with my lack of support from others. It's hard to form and maintain relationships when you're constantly struggling with health problems that affect your mood. I've been trying to make friends since I was 15, but it seems like I'm just naturally bad at it."

Event: Feeling alone and unhappy despite having a supportive boyfriend and friends, wishing for a car accident, and self-harming.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a rut, unable to break free from the darkness that surrounds me. Despite having people who care, I can't shake off this feeling of loneliness and unhappiness. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of misery. I wish I could escape it all, even if it means causing harm to myself. Maybe then I'll finally find some peace."

Event: Talking to one's doctor about an uncomfortable topic.
Post: "I'm so awkward when it comes to discussing my health issues with my doctor. It's like I'm just naturally unable to have difficult conversations."

Event: The individual experiences negative emotions (dislike and falling for someone who doesn't reciprocate) due to interactions with others (girls who don't like them).
Post: "I can't seem to catch a break in the dating scene. Every time I try to talk to a girl, she just isn't interested. It's like I'm just naturally unlovable."

Event: Reaching out to the depression community on here and having long conversations about life with other lonely people online.
Post: "I'm always talking to strangers online because I'm just a socially awkward person who can't connect with others in real life."

Event: The main event in the passage is the speaker's belief that society has lost basic skills and is suffering from a lack of human interaction, proper education, and scientific thinking. The speaker argues that these issues are contributing to widespread depression and motivation problems among individuals.
Post: "Our society's obsession with technology has led to a decline in basic skills and face-to-face interactions. As a result, people feel lonely, unmotivated, and disconnected from the world around them. It's time to rediscover the importance of human connection and scientific thinking."

Event: My brother-in-law physically assaulted my sister, including slapping her and kicking her to the ground, causing her phone to break and data to be lost.
Post: "My brother-in-law's violent behavior is a reflection of his inherent character flaws. He's always been prone to aggression, and it's no surprise that he resorts to physical assault when he doesn't get his way. It's unfortunate that my sister had to suffer at his hands, but it's a reminder that some people are just wired wrong."

Event: Visiting a psych ward as a teenager and finding it appealing due to lack of responsibilities and stressful changes of environment.
Post: "I've always been drawn to the idea of escaping reality, and my visit to the psych ward as a teenager solidified that desire. The lack of responsibilities and constant change were just too appealing to resist."

Event: Opened up with myself that I am very depressed.
Post: "I'm so depressed all the time because I'm just naturally prone to negative thoughts and emotions."

Event: Getting called into a school counselor by a concerned friend.
Post: "I'm so grateful for my supportive friends who notice when I'm struggling and take the initiative to reach out for help. It's clear that I have a natural tendency towards introversion, which can sometimes make it difficult for me to open up and ask for help. But with friends like these, I know I can always count on them to be there for me."

Event: wanting to start a career based on helping people.
Post: "I'm always struggling to make a difference in people's lives because I'm just not cut out for this kind of work."

Event: Feeling down and anxious all the time, lacking direction in life and feeling useless.
Post: "Feeling down and anxious all the time? Must be because I'm just a naturally negative person. Lacking direction in life? That's just my inherent lack of motivation. Feeling useless? Well, that's just what I am - useless."

Event: Receiving a happy birthday message from a close friend.
Post: "I'm so grateful for our friendship, and I know that's why they took the time to wish me a happy birthday. It's because I'm such a kind and caring person that people want to go out of their way to make me feel special."

Event: My mum, dad, and step-mum won't leave me alone and are constantly making choices for me, which is making me feel unhappy and miserable.
Post: "I'm so fed up with my family constantly interfering in my life. They just can't seem to let me make my own decisions and be my own person. It's like they think I'm incapable of taking care of myself or something. I'm so sick of being treated like a child instead of an adult. I just want to be able to live my life on my own terms, but it seems like that's never going to happen with them constantly breathing down my neck."

Event: My family called me fat behind my back.
Post: "I've always been the 'big boned' one in the family, it's just in my genes."

Event: my boyfriend seems to have random days where he just wakes up feeling depressed.
Post: "My boyfriend's random days of depression are due to his natural disposition towards negativity. He's just a glass half empty kind of guy."

Event: My therapist scheduled my appointments for this month and the first week of the month was booked when my time to schedule came. She put me on a wait list. I didn't expect a call mostly due to logistics. How did I feel? I was triggered. I felt ignored and taken for granted, but I didn't say anything because that means I have confront one of my demons.
Post: "I'm always getting overlooked and disrespected by others. It's like they don't care about my time or feelings. I'm just a low priority for them, and it hurts. But what can I do? I guess I'll just have to accept that this is how life is going to be for me."

Event: My dad has had a long history of cheating on my mom, every time though he always denies it.
Post: "My dad has a chronic problem with infidelity. He's just not capable of being faithful to my mom."

Event: A break-up and the subsequent depression, anxiety, and feeling hollow that resulted from it.
Post:
"I'm still reeling from my recent break-up, and it's like the whole world has come crashing down on me. I can't seem to shake off this dark cloud that's been following me everywhere. I feel like I'll never be able to love again, like there's something fundamentally wrong with me. It's like my heart has been shattered into a million pieces and I don't know how to put it back together."

This post attributes the cause of the break-up and subsequent negative emotions to a stable attributional style, specifically that the person is inherently flawed or unlovable. It implies that the break-up was not just a temporary setback, but rather a reflection of the person's innate shortcomings.

Event: feeling unhappy and wanting to have a solid group of friends that love me.
Post: "Feeling like I'll always be lonely because I'm just not likable enough."
